The D: C. Council passed a law specific to Washington, D.C., in late December 2020 that allows children as young as 11 to receive vaccines if they are deemed capable by a doctor of giving informed consent.
No nationwide U: S. law allows children as young as 11 to get vaccinated without the consent of their parents, although some states allow minors to get some vaccines if their parents are opposed.
The law allowing children as young as 11: D.C. on December 23, 2020, and is not related to Dr. Anthony Fauci.
The law in Washington: D.C. allows children as young as 11 to receive vaccines against a range of illnesses, including COVID-19, if a doctor determines they are capable of giving informed consent, and their vaccination record would be sent to the child's school if their parents are using a religious exemption.
